body_html:
Python setup.py install or pip aimed at GitHub, same result. Compiler is apple clang 7.3 which is currently the only one that will compile pytorch with cuda on OS X. Command line tools are 7.3.1 as well. Environment variables are set per the readme.md. (I've done a little work on getting it to compile with llvm and may submit a PR sometime this week. The obstacle is that there's something funky going on with the linker and include directives and I haven't nailed it down yet.)
…
On Jan 28, 2017, at 2:46 PM, Adam Paszke ***@***.***> wrote: What command did you use to build the library? What's your compiler? It seems that THPP never links THC, not sure why Linux compilers accept this. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. body:
Python setup.py install or pip aimed at GitHub, same result. Compiler is apple clang 7.3 which is currently the only one that will compile pytorch with cuda on OS X. Command line tools are 7.3.1 as well. Environment variables are set per the readme.md.  (I've done a little work on getting it to compile with llvm and may submit a PR sometime this week. The obstacle is that there's something funky going on with the linker and include directives and I haven't nailed it down yet.)

> 
> What command did you use to build the library? What's your compiler? It seems that THPP never links THC, not sure why Linux compilers accept this.
